# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All"

source.1630c633:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.b4c1edb1:
plt.figure(figsize=(20,6))
splot=sns.barplot(x="Discipline",y="Female",data=eg.sort_values(by=["Female"],ascending=False))
plt.xticks(rotation="vertical")
plt.bar_label(splot.containers[0])
plt.title("Disciplines with no. of Female participants",fontsize=20,fontweight="bold")
source.ab97dc2d:
plt.figure(figsize=(20,6))
splot=sns.barplot(x="Discipline",y="Male",data=eg.sort_values(by=["Male"],ascending=False))
                                                                     
plt.xticks(rotation="vertical")
plt.bar_label(splot.containers[0])
plt.title("Disciplines with no. of Male participants",fontsize=20,fontweight="bold")
source.51c89509:
plt.figure(figsize=(10,7))
pie=plt.pie(x=medals["Total"],autopct='%1.02f%%',radius=4)
plt.legend(pie[0],labels=medals["Team/NOC"], bbox_to_anchor=(1,0), loc="best", 
                          bbox_transform=plt.gcf().transFigure)
plt.title("Total medals won by the participating Countries represented as a percentage",fontsize=20,fontweight="bold",loc="left")

source.53218d37:
plt.figure(figsize=(20,6))
tca=athletes.groupby(by=["Discipline"]).count().sort_values(by=['Name'],ascending=False)
tca.drop(columns="NOC",inplace=True)
linewidths = 0.003
linecolor = "white"
sns.heatmap(data=tca,linewidths=linewidths,linecolor=linecolor)
plt.title("Disciplines having the most athletes represented as a Heatmap",fontweight="bold",fontsize=20)
source.e2dc46a4:
rep=pivot_noc.sort_values(by=["Name"],ascending=False)
plt.figure(figsize=(20,6))
splot=sns.barplot(x=rep.head(30).index,y="Name",data=rep.head(30))
plt.xticks(rotation="vertical")
plt.bar_label(splot.containers[0])
plt.title("Top 30 Countries with the most respresenting athletes",fontweight="bold",fontsize=20)
